author: Martin Fricker
title: Bigamist caught out by his own sat-nav just two weeks after he married second bride
text:
A bigamist who secretly married another woman behind his wife’s back was caught out by his own sat-nav. 
Lying Michael Hardy, 45, tied the knot with Joanne White while still hitched to wife of two years Caroline Lacey. 
She became suspicious after the same address kept appearing on his van’s sat-nav and he began staying out late. 
The 46-year-old, who survived cervical cancer , marched round to the address and caught him with his blonde mistress. 
When Caroline confronted the pair she was astonished to be told by Joanne: “But I’m his wife. We got married two weeks ago.” 
The furious mum-of-two shopped her husband to the police and he has been hauled before a judge for bigamy. 
Caroline told the Mirror: “He’s a lying, cheating conman. I can’t believe he had the brass neck to marry someone else.” 
Hardy admitted bigamy when he appeared before magistrates in Walsall between Christmas and New Year. 
The landscaping firm manager was given a six-month suspended sentence at Wolverhampton Crown Court . Read More Caroline and Michael on their wedding day (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Recorder Collingwood Thompson told him: “You carried out a gross deception.” 
Caroline, originally from Romsey, Hants, was going through a divorce when she met Hardy via a lonely hearts advert in 2013. 
“He got in touch and we really hit it off,” she told the Mirror. “He said he was living with his mum and was single. 
“We met up and he came round to my place and literally never left. He moved in that day. Michael thought of himself as my saviour because I’d been through abuse previously. 
“He was like a bodyguard and made me feel safe, but looking back on it he was already taking control. 
“I didn’t realise it at the time because I was falling madly in love with him. I think he just wanted a home. He quickly proposed and I accepted. Everything was fine, everything was good.” 
The happy couple got married in front of dozens of friends and family at Romsey Town Hall in 2014. 
“The wedding day was beautiful,” sobbed Caroline. “I felt like the luckiest woman in the world.” 
In his speech, Hardy beamed: “I can’t think of anyone better to spend the rest of my life with than Caroline. She’s everything to me.” Michael leaving Wolverhapton Court (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
The couple moved to Walsall, West Mids, with Caroline’s daughter Charlotte last June after he got a promotion. 
“I didn’t want to move but also didn’t want to stand in his way, so we moved up to Walsall in June,” she said. 
“Everything was fine initially. He was enjoying the work and I was settling into the area. 
“But one night in October he said he was going to help salt the car park of a bingo place in Birmingham and didn’t come home.” 
Incredibly Hardy rang Caroline and claimed he had been injured at work and was being treated in a psychiatric hospital for a breakdown. 
“I didn’t have a clue what was going on but believed what he was telling me,” she said. 
“I know it sounds crazy. He said he’d suffered a breakdown and needed to stay in hospital. 
“He would come and see me three times a week and we’d sleep together, but he always said he had to go back to hospital at night. 
“Looking back on it, I was an idiot. He was clearly with his other woman but I just believed what he said.” 
Wolverhampton Crown Court heard that unbeknown to Caroline, Hardy had met Joanne via an online dating website in August. Caroline Lacey was Michael's first wife (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Claiming to be a fireman, he told her he was a widower and chillingly said Caroline had died from cervical cancer a year earlier. 
Prosecutor Edward Soulsby said Joanne fell for Hardy and his lies and accepted his proposal five weeks before Christmas. 
They tied the knot in a religious service at a registry office in Birmingham in front of 45 guests on December 10 last year. 
Meanwhile Caroline and her daughter began to suspect Hardy was not telling the truth. 
She said: “I remembered the same address used to always appear on his sat-nav. Every time he got it out he’d type the same road in. 
“Also sometimes he rang me from the van and I’d hear the sat-nav reading out the address. 
“I said to Charlotte that we needed to find out if something is going on.” 
The pair walked the ten miles to the address in Weoley Castle, Birmingham, on December 19 and incredibly spotted Hardy’s van parked outside a house. 
“Charlotte saw it first and then realised he was sitting in it with a blonde woman in the passenger seat,” she said. 
“I couldn’t believe it. We ran over and he tried to keep us away from her. He tried to push us down the road. Caroline Lacey showing her 007 Michael tattoo (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
“I said, ‘What’s going on? What’s with this blonde bit?’ At that point she climbed out of the van. 
“I said, ‘I’m his wife’ and she said, ‘No, I’m his wife. We got married two weeks ago’. I said, ‘That’s funny, because we’ve been married for two years’. He just stood there with his head down. 
“She went mad and he was trying to calm her down. He even begged me to tell her I was his sister. He was all over the place. 
“I went home and cried myself to sleep, then decided to report him to the police the next day.” 
Hardy was arrested by officers from West Midlands Police on December 28 and admitted bigamy in court the following day. 
As well as the suspended jail term, he has also been ordered to complete 120 hours community service. 
He must also pay prosecution costs of £340 and complete a 20-day rehabilitation programme. 
Hardy’s lawyer Claire Evans described his actions as a “farce” and said he was “extremely remorseful”. 
The court heard Joanne is standing by him and “thinks she can make a good man out of him”. Caroline and Michael on their wedding day (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Caroline, who has now returned to Hampshire, said: “I’m just totally devastated. 
“I can’t stop loving him, even after all he has done. I thought I was going to be with him for the rest of my life. 
“He was the man for me from the moment we set eyes on each other. Now I’ve got nothing. I love him with all my heart and still do, but I know I can’t go back to him after what he’s done. 
“I feel physically crushed. If it wasn’t for Charlotte I don’t think I’d be here today. For someone you love to do this breaks your heart. There was no inkling that he was cheating on me.” 
Charlotte, a carer, added: “He was like a dad to me. I don’t think I’ll ever understand why he did what he did.” 
Hardy’s other ‘wife’ Joanne refused to comment when contacted by the Daily Mirror. 
Hardy said outside court: “I’m truly sorry. In hindsight I should have really worked at it with Caroline.” What is bigamy 
Bigamy is defined as the act of entering into marriage with a person when already legally married to another. 
The second marriage is deemed illegal and invalid as long as the first spouse is alive and a divorce has not been finalised. 
Bigamy has been an offence in England and Wales since the 19th century. 
The crime falls under section 57 of the Offences Against the Person Act 1861. 
A person found guilty of bigamy can be jailed for seven years or fined, or both. Exceptions may be made where someone has not heard from their partner for seven years and is unsure if they are alive. 
In some cases, allowances can also be made if someone genuinely believes their marriage has been dissolved. 
People who have legally married multiple partners in other countries will not be charged with bigamy in the UK unless they marry again in this country. Like us on Facebook
